MovieReviews.ActorName: Steve Carell, Steve Buscemi, Olivia Wilde, Jim Carrey, James Gandolfini, Alan Arkin, Jay Mohr
MovieReviews.Review: Steve Carrell lacks his usual charm, and Steve Buscemi disappears halfway through.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Selena Gomez, James Franco, Vanessa Hudgens, Ashley Benson, Rachel Korine
MovieReviews.Review: Hard-core revelry goes on a downward spiral of debauchery, without plot or good characters.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Rachel Mwanza, Alain Lino Mic Eli Bastien, Serge Kanyinda, Mizinga Mwinga
MovieReviews.Review: Rachel Mwanza's measured narration is in stark contrast to the horrendously violent acts her character is forced to commit.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Halle Berry, Abigail Breslin, Morris Chestnut, Michael Eklund

MovieReviews.ActorName: Colin Farrell, Noomi Rapace, Isabelle Huppert, Terrence Howard, Dominic Cooper
MovieReviews.Review: This action thriller that doesn't thrill is well-acted but lacks substance.

MovieReviews.Review: The Oscar-nominated documentary examines the Israeli-Palestinian conflict from the perspective of Shin Bet leaders.

MovieReviews.Review: The historical portions of this postwar drama outshine the generic romance.

MovieReviews.ActorName: James Franco, Michelle Williams, Rachel Weisz, Mila Kunis, Zach Braff
MovieReviews.Review: 'Oz the Great and Powerful' is good, escapist fun.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Neal Schon, Ross Valory, Jonathan Cain, Deen Castronovo, Arnel Pineda
MovieReviews.Review: You don't need to be a Journey fan to savor this compelling global Cinderella story.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Miles Teller, Skylar Astin, Justin Chon, Francois Chau, Sarah Wright
MovieReviews.Review: It doesn't get much more childish than this offensive, humorless film.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Ed Harris, David Duchovny, William Fichtner, Jonathon Schaech
MovieReviews.Review: Ed Harris plays a Soviet naval commander on his proverbial "final mission." Who knew the brink of nuclear war could be so dull?

MovieReviews.ActorName: Nicholas Hoult, Eleanor Tomlinson, Ewan McGregor, Stanley Tucci, Ian McShane, Bill Nighy
MovieReviews.Review: The movie version of the fairy tale is game for swashbuckling fantasy and thrills.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Mia Wasikowska, Nicole Kidman, Matthew Goode
MovieReviews.Review: The Gothic thriller, while artfully made, has more tedium than peril.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Dwayne Johnson, Susan Sarandon, Jon Bernthal, Barry Pepper, Benjamin Bratt
MovieReviews.Review: Drama and suspense fuel a surprisingly effective thriller, more than car chases and action.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Miriam Colon, Luke Ganalon, Dolores Heredia, Benito Martinez, Castulo Guerra, Joaquin Cosio
MovieReviews.Review: The simplest remedy: More screen time for the mystical healer herself.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Gael García Bernal, Alfredo Castro, Antonia Zegers
MovieReviews.Review: Media history, political turmoil and shrewd manipulation are examined in this probing drama.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Julianna Hough, Josh Duhamel, David Lyons, Mimi Kirkland, Noah Lomax
MovieReviews.Review: This film deviates somewhat from the usual Nicholas Sparks movies, but hits familiar notes. Mostly it's dogged by bad performances.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Alden Ehrenreich, Alice Englert, Viola Davis, Emma Thompson, Jeremy Irons
MovieReviews.Review: The supernatural romance, while predictable, also has impressive Southern settings.

MovieReviews.MovieName: A Good Day to Die Hard

MovieReviews.Review: The fifth Die Hard installment is a feeble attempt to rehash action-hero glories.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Melissa McCarthy, Jason Bateman, Eric Stonestreet, Jonathan Banks

MovieReviews.ActorName: Rooney Mara, Jude Law, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Channing Tatum
MovieReviews.Review: With a strong first half and mild finale, thriller loses its potency.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Nicholas Hoult, Teresa Palmer, Rob Corddry, John Malkovich
MovieReviews.Review: Zombie story makes Twilight look positively intellectual.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Al Pacino, Christopher Walken, Alan Arkin, Julianna Margulies
MovieReviews.Review: It's been a long time since a movie wasted as much talent as Stand Up Guys.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Jeremy Renner, Gemma Arterton, Famke Janssen
MovieReviews.Review: This convoluted hybrid of fairy tale and fantasy/action/comedy/horror aims for campy fun, but comes off tedious and blood-spattered.

MovieReviews.Review: Dustin Hoffman's directorial debut makes beautiful music.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Mark Wahlberg, Russell Crowe, Catherine Zeta-Jones
MovieReviews.Review: Mark Wahlberg and Russell Crowe face off in a tired tale of political corruption.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Emmanuelle Riva, Jean-Louis Trintignant

MovieReviews.ActorName: Sean Penn, Ryan Gosling, Josh Brolin, Nick Nolte, Emma Stone
MovieReviews.Review: An unconvincing tale and cartoonish contrivances make for a second-rate pulpy thriller.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Naomi Watts, Ewan McGregor, Tom Holland, Samuel Joslin

MovieReviews.Review: Damon shines in one of his best roles in this tale of small-town America.

MovieReviews.ActorName: John Magaro, Jack Huston, Will Brill, James Gandolfini
MovieReviews.Review: This uneven coming-of-age drama brings the soundtrack of the 1960s to vivid life.

MovieReviews.Review: The weight and ugliness of slavery is felt in this clever, ambitious and superbly acted tale of wish fulfillment.

MovieReviews.Review: An innocent if ineffective film about the challenges of aging — and parenting.

MovieReviews.Review: Tom Cruise returns to action as the mysterious do-gooder.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Barbra Streisand, Seth Rogen, Kathy Najimy, Colin Hanks
MovieReviews.Review: It's hard to buy Streisand playing the bossiest of Uber-moms.

MovieReviews.Review: It takes two hours to get to the killing of Osama bin Laden, but that sequence is well worth the wait.

MovieReviews.Review: Playing for Keeps is a throwaway movie if ever there was one.

MovieReviews.Review: This examination of physical and psychological wounds offers a superb performance by Marion Cotillard and a less convincing one by her co-star.

MovieReviews.Review: The latest undead-soldier story carries on the franchise tradition of graphic violence and bad acting.

MovieReviews.Review: A charismatic hired gun played by Brad Pitt does nothing softly in this hyper-violent, visually stunning and well-written thriller.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Alicia Vikander, Mads Mikkelsen, Mikkel Boe Folsgaard

MovieReviews.ActorName: Anthony Hopkins, Helen Mirren, Scarlett Johansson, Danny Huston

MovieReviews.ActorName: Suraj Sharma, Irrfan Khan, Adil Hussain, Gérard Depardieu

MovieReviews.ActorName: Alec Baldwin, Chris Pine, Hugh Jackman, Isla Fisher, Jude Law
MovieReviews.Review: The computer-animated tale is a charming spectacle, if a little overloaded.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, David Strathairn, Tommy Lee Jones

MovieReviews.ActorName: Denzel Washington, John Goodman, Don Cheadle

MovieReviews.Review: The cinematography is gorgeous and the makeup amazing, but the story lines are too disconnected.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Ethan Hawke, Juliet Rylance, James Ranson

MovieReviews.Review: This movie seems destined to have a short shelf life.

MovieReviews.ActorName: Deepak Chopra, Gotham Chopra

MovieReviews.Review: The tale of collegiate a cappella singing groups recalls glory days of 'Glee.'

MovieReviews.MPAARating: Rated R for sexual content, graphic nudity and language
MovieReviews.Review: Great acting and flawless production design can't make up for a muddled story.

MovieReviews.MPAARating: Rated R for language and sexual content

Josh Radnor directs and stars as thirtysomething who goes back to his idyllic college.
